name: FRACTUS-23.2
description:
The idea that nature, as the place where we position human is an extension of nature, trying to shed light on its own eternal existence, as an effort to make sense and analyze itself; Hegel's "Deadly sick nature." All attempts to establish a new balance between human and nature, to remove its excessive character from human activity and incorporate it into the regular balance of nature, are nothing but a series of efforts to erect an original and insurmountable distance, contrary to the saying that we do not separate ourselves from nature, the sharp distinction in the artificial-natural dilemma. Can we imagine a future with Aristotle's phrase “human completes what nature left unfinished”, at a point where we ignore all human beings as an extension of nature, consider all their productions natural, and render human harm beneficial?

In line with this questions, I create serial nebulae that I call “fractus”, which I transform into a visual reality by using different materials*, intertwined chaotic and having fictitious truths in themselves.

*I make oil paintings of the drawings I sketch. Afterwards, I photograph my oil paintings in macro scale and transform them into their new form in digital environment.
